benchmark_details.name: PBLBench
benchmark_details.overview: PBLBench is a novel benchmark designed to evaluate complex reasoning grounded in domain-specific knowledge and long-context understanding for STEM-based Project-Based Learning (PBL) outcomes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of state-of-the-art multimodal large language models (MLLMs) in assessing multi-modal STEM-based Project-Based Learning outcomes.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The overall scale of the dataset remains limited, necessitating the collection of additional samples.

data.source: Constructed from over 500 multimodal PBL projects.
data.annotation: Evaluation criteria derived using the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) with expert-driven pairwise comparisons.

methodology.calculation: Rank accuracy calculated based on model's performance compared to human evaluators.
methodology.interpretation: Models should closely match human scores to be considered effective.
methodology.baseline_results: The highest ranked model achieved only 59% rank accuracy.

targeted_risks.harm: Models exhibit significant hallucinations and instability leading to inaccurate evaluations.
